tingle_pilot_study.data package¶

Submodules¶

tingle_pilot_study.data.dataloader module¶

tingle_pilot_study.data.dataloader.combine_coordinators(data)¶

Function to combine coordinator rows from 2 to 1.

data : DataFrame
DataFrame with separate coordinator rows
data : DataFrame
DataFrame with combined coordinator rows
tingle_pilot_study.data.dataloader.correct_corrections(df, corrections)¶

Function to correct data entry errors

df: DataFrame

corrections: dictionary

key: participant number value: dictionary

key: column value: dictionary

key: incorrect value value: dictionary

key: string
“value” or “column”
value: anything that can go in a DataFrame cell
value or column name
df2: DataFrame
updated
tingle_pilot_study.data.dataloader.correct_targets(df, targets)¶

Function to update targets that were steamrolled during data collection. 🧖

df: DataFrame

targets: dictionary
key: numeric
step
value: string
target
or string
URL to JSON with respective labels “number” and “target” for key and value

df: DataFrame

tingle_pilot_study.data.dataloader.count_ontarget_samples(df, human_readable=False)¶

Function to count usable samples.

df: DataFrame

human_readable: Boolean, optional
default=False
ontarget_counts: DataFrame
MultiIndexed if human_readable, otherwise “step” by “participant”

Function to drop data annotated to drop.

df: DataFrame

X: list of strings, optional
notes values indicating to drop an iteration

df: DataFrame

tingle_pilot_study.data.dataloader.index_participants(df)¶

Function to index participants

df: DataFrame

participants_df: DataFrame

tingle_pilot_study.data.dataloader.load_from_firebase(dbURL='https://tingle-pilot-collected-data.firebaseio.com/', notes=False, start=None, stop=None, combine=False, marked=False)¶

Function to load data from Firebase. Requires [Firebase service account credentials](https://console.firebase.google.com/project/tingle-pilot-collected-data/settings/serviceaccounts/adminsdk) in JSON format.

dbURL : string (optional)
Firebase database to pull data from
notes : Boolean (optional)
Return notes as well as data?
start : date or datetime (optional)
start time of data to include (eg, datetime.date(2018,3,6))
stop : date or datetime (optional)
stop time of data to include (eg, datetime.date(2018,3,6))
combine : Boolean (optional)
combine coordinators into a single row?
marked : Boolean (optional)
only include ontarget==True rows?
data : DataFrame
Pandas DataFrame of data from Firebase
notes : DataFrame (optional)
Pandas DataFrame of notes from Firebase iff parameter notes==True,
tingle_pilot_study.data.dataloader.lookup_counts(row, lookup_table, index='step', columns='participant', default=False)¶

Function to apply to a DataFrame to cross-reference counts in a lookup_table.

row: Series
row of a DataFrame
lookup_table: DataFrame
DataFrame to cross-reference
index: string or numeric, opitional
name of column in row that contains an index value for lookup_table, default = “step”
columns: string or numeric, opitional
name of column in row that contains a column name for lookup_table, default = “participant”
default: boolean or other, optional
value to return if lookup not in lookup table default = False
value: boolean or other
the value at index, columns; otherwise default
tingle_pilot_study.data.dataloader.split_participants(df)¶

Function to split DataFrame into separate participants

df: DataFrame

dfs: list of DataFrames

tingle_pilot_study.data.dataloader.update_from_one(row)¶

Function to update rows that need updated from agreement to single_coordinator

row: Series

updated: Boolean or other

>>> import pandas as pd
>>> row = pd.Series(
...     {
...         "one_coordinator": True,
...         "both_coordinators": False,
...         "needs_updated": True
...     }
... )
>>> update_from_one(row)
True

>>> import pandas as pd
>>> row = pd.Series(
...     {
...         "one_coordinator": True,
...         "both_coordinators": False,
...         "needs_updated": False
...     }
... )
>>> update_from_one(row)
False

>>> import pandas as pd
>>> row = pd.Series(
...     {
...         "one_coordinator": False,
...         "both_coordinators": False,
...         "needs_updated": True
...     }
... )
>>> update_from_one(row)
False
tingle_pilot_study.data.dataloader.update_too_few(df, condition)¶

Function to update a DataFrame with an inappropriate number of samples in coordinator agreement.

df: DataFrame
DataFrame to update
condition: string
definition of inappropriate count, eg, “< 5”
df: DataFrame
DataFrame updated with single-rater matches replacing dual-rater agreement in cases indicated by condition
